title: 115_s62
content: The Act may be cited as the "January 8th National Memorial Act" and includes findings. The tragedy on January 8, 2011, at Congresswoman Gabrielle Gifford's event resulted in the deaths of 6 people and injuries to 13 others. On January 8, 2011, an assassination attempt was made on Congresswoman Gabrielle Giffords during a meeting with constituents. The attack resulted in the deaths of six individuals (including Dorwan Stoddard and Gabe Zimmerman) and injuries to 13 others. Giffords sustained severe injuries that continue to affect her, while Zimmerman became the first Congressional staffer to be assassinated in the line of duty. An assassination attempt was made on Congresswoman Giffords while meeting with constituents, resulting in severe injuries. Gabe Zimmerman was the first Congressional staffer assassinated in the line of duty. The Arizona community and people worldwide came together to support each other at memorial sites. The Arizona community and people worldwide came together to provide comfort and support at memorial sites following the assassination attempt on Congresswoman Giffords. The Tucson's January 8th Memorial will honor those who died that day. The Tucson's January 8th Memorial will serve as a tribute to the victims of the tragedy and as a symbol of the community's resilience and democracy's strength in the United States. It will be a place for visitors to learn about the event and the response to it. The January 8th National Memorial will honor the victims of a tragedy and symbolize community resilience and democracy's strength in the United States. The January 8th National Memorial, established by the Tucson's January 8th Memorial Foundation, is defined by key terms such as "Memorial," "Foundation," "Map," and "Secretary." The January 8th National Memorial, established by the Tucson's January 8th Memorial Foundation, is defined by key terms such as "Memorial," "Foundation," "Map," and "Secretary." The Memorial will be established as an affiliated area of the National Park System once the Foundation complies with the Secretary's requirements. The January 8th National Memorial, established by the Tucson's January 8th Memorial Foundation, will be affiliated with the National Park System once the Foundation establishes a trust fund as certified by the Secretary of the Interior. The Memorial will not be established until the Foundation sets up a trust fund for receiving donations and managing the Memorial's construction and operation. The Foundation established a trust fund for receiving donations and managing the construction, operation, maintenance, and management of the Memorial. The Memorial will consist of the area depicted as the "Memorial Boundary" on the map, with the Foundation being responsible for its administration. The Foundation is the management entity responsible for the construction, operation, maintenance, and management of the Memorial depicted as the "Memorial Boundary" on the map. If the Foundation fails to manage the Memorial according to laws applicable to the National Park System or ceases to maintain the trust fund, the Memorial will no longer be affiliated with the National Park System. The Foundation must manage the Memorial according to National Park System laws and maintain the trust fund. The map of the Memorial is available for public inspection at National Park Service offices. The Secretary can provide technical assistance and enter into cooperative agreements. The Secretary can provide technical assistance and enter into cooperative agreements with the Foundation for the Memorial's marketing. The Secretary is limited in acquiring property or using Federal funds for the Memorial's construction or maintenance. The Secretary can provide technical assistance and enter into cooperative agreements with the Foundation for the Memorial's marketing. The Secretary is limited in acquiring property or using Federal funds for the Memorial's construction or maintenance. The Secretary, in consultation with the Foundation, shall develop a general management plan for the Memorial in accordance with section 100502 of title 54, United States Code. The Secretary, in consultation with the Foundation, will develop a general management plan for the Memorial in accordance with section 100502 of title 54, United States Code, to be completed within 3 years of funds availability. The Secretary will provide a copy of the completed general management plan to the House Committee on Natural Resources and the Senate Committee on Energy and Natural Resources within 3 years of funds availability for the Act or the establishment of the Memorial.
